intro: Tristemma mauritianum var. mauritianum, commonly known as the Mauritius starling tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
